CatDescriptText: Mrs. Marcella Young, beautician, Homewood and Mrs. Bessie Lyman, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 7, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Admitting many factors cause juvenile delinquency, which one do you think is the major contributor to this increasing social illness?" Mrs. MarcelaYoung's answer reads: "I say the home, although I do dwell a lot on the community environment and consider and include the social action it provides.  However, I think the home environment is more important..." Mrs. Bessie Lyman's answer reads: "The parents are the chief cause.  The home environment is the cause.  Religion, more religion, should be in the home.  The parents should really train the child by ruling their homes..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Marcella Young wearing coat with two large buttons, gloves, and patterned scarf, holding eyeglasses, standing in front of brick wall; Portrait of Bessie Lyman wearing beret and scarf, standing in front of brick wall
